widget.name: Braintree Drop In
widget.description: Braintree drop-in implemented as Mendix pluggable widget

property.caption: Client nonce
property.description: Nonce from the client after form submit.

property.caption: Device data
property.description: Device data captured from the client after form submit.

property.caption: Authorization
property.description: A tokenization key or a client token. If authorization is a client token created with a customer ID, Drop-in will render saved payment methods and automatically store any newly-added payment methods in their Vault record.

property.caption: Locale
property.description: Use this option to change the language, links, and terminology used throughout Drop-in.

property.defaultValue: card, paypal, paypalCredit, venmo, applePay, googlePay
property.caption: Payment option priority
property.description: Use this option to indicate the order in which enabled payment options should appear when multiple payment options are enabled. By default, payment options will appear in this order: card, paypal, paypalCredit, venmo, applePay, googlePay. Payment options omitted from this array will not be offered to the customer.

property.caption: Venmo
property.description:
The configuration options for Pay with Venmo. To include a Venmo option in your Drop-in integration, include the venmo parameter and follow the documentation for setting up Venmo in the Braintree control panel. If a user's browser does not support Venmo, the Venmo option will not be rendered.
See Venmo create options tab for venmo options.

property.caption: Data collector
property.description: If true is passed, Drop-in will be configured to collect data for use with Advanced Fraud Protection. If collecting data via Kount, pass a dataCollectorOptions object with kount: true instead. If Data Collector is configured and fails to load, Drop-in creation will fail.

property.caption: Vault manager
property.description: Whether or not to allow a customer to delete saved payment methods when used with a client token with a customer id. Note: Deleting a payment method from Drop-in will permanently delete the payment method, so this option is not recommended for merchants using Braintree's recurring billing system. This feature is not supported in Internet Explorer 9.

property.caption: Preselect vaulted payment method
property.description: Whether or not to initialize Drop-in with a vaulted payment method pre-selected. Only applicable when using a client token with a customer id and a customer with saved payment methods.

property.caption: Data source
property.description: This will be used to configure options throughout the widget. Select data source that returns 1 object.

property.caption: Card
property.description: The configuration options for cards. See Card create options tab for all card options. If this option is omitted, cards will still appear as a payment option. To remove cards, pass false for the value.

property.caption: Clear fields after tokenization
property.description: When false, the card form will not clear the card data when the customer returns to the card view after a successful tokenization.

property.caption: Allow vault card override
property.description: When true, the card form will include an option to let the customer decide not to vault the credit card they enter.

property.caption: Vault card
property.description: Whether or not to vault the card upon tokenization. When set to false with Allow vault card override set to false, then cards will not be vaulted.

property.caption: Cardholder name
property.description: Will enable a cardholder name field above the card number field. If set to an object, you can specify whether or not the field is required. If set to true, it will default the field to being present, but not required.

property.caption: Cardholder name required
property.description: When true, the cardholder name field will be required to request the payment method nonce.

property.caption: Overrides fields
property.description: The Hosted Fields fields options. Only number, cvv, expirationDate and postalCode can be configured. Each is a Hosted Fields field object. selector cannot be modified.

property.caption: Field option
property.description: Select the field options you want to customise.

property.caption: Placeholder
property.description: Will be used as the placeholder attribute of the input. If placeholder is not natively supported by the browser, it will be polyfilled.

property.caption: Type
property.description: Will be used as the type attribute of the input. To mask cvv input, for instance, type: "password" can be used.

property.caption: iframe title
property.description: The title used for the iframe containing the credit card input. By default, this will be Secure Credit Card Frame - <the name of the specific field>.

property.caption: Internal label
property.description: Each Hosted Field iframe has a hidden label that is used by screen readers to identify the input. The internalLabel property can be used to customize the field for localization purposes.

property.caption: Prefill
property.description: A value to prefill the field with. For example, when creating an update card form, you can prefill the expiration date fields with the old expiration date data.

property.caption: Format input
property.description: Enable or disable automatic formatting on this field.

property.caption: Mask input
property.description: Enable or disable input masking when input is not focused. If set to true instead of an object, the defaults for the maskInput parameters will be used.

property.caption: Mask input character
property.description: The character to use when masking the input. The default character ('•') uses a unicode symbol, so the webpage must support UTF-8 characters when using the default.

property.caption: Mask input show last four
property.description: Only applicable for the credit card field. Whether or not to show the last 4 digits of the card when masking.

property.caption: Select
property.description: If true, this field becomes a <select> dropdown list. This can only be used for expirationMonth and expirationYear fields. If you do not use a placeholder property for the field, the current month/year will be the default selected value.

property.caption: Max card length
property.description: This option applies only to the number field. Allows a limit to the length of the card number, even if the card brand may support numbers of a greater length. If the value passed is greater than the max length for a card brand, the smaller number of the 2 values will be used. For example, is maxCardLength is set to 16, but an American Express card is entered (which has a max card length of 15), a max card length of 15 will be used.

property.caption: Max length
property.description: This option applies only to the CVV and postal code fields. Will be used as the maxlength attribute of the input. The primary use cases for the maxlength option are: limiting the length of the CVV input for CVV-only verifications when the card type is known and setting the length of the postal code input when cards are coming from a known region. The default maxlength for the postal code input is 10.

property.caption: Min length
property.description: This option applies only to the cvv and postal code fields. Will be used as the minlength attribute of the input. For postal code fields, the default value is 3, representing the Icelandic postal code length. This option's primary use case is to increase the minlength, e.g. for US customers, the postal code minlength can be set to 5. For cvv fields, the default value is 3. The minlength attribute only applies to integrations capturing a cvv without a number field.

property.caption: PayPal
property.description: Set to to enable PayPal configuration.

property.caption: Flow
property.description: Set to 'checkout' for one-time payment flow, or 'vault' for Vault flow. If 'vault' is used with a client token generated with a customer ID, the PayPal account will be added to that customer as a saved payment method.

property.caption: Amount
property.description: The amount of the transaction. Required when using the Checkout flow.

property.caption: Currency
property.description: The currency code of the amount, such as 'USD'. Required when using the Checkout flow.

property.caption: Commit
property.description: The user action to show on the PayPal review page. If true, a Pay Now button will be shown. If false, a Continue button will be shown.

enumerationValues.enumerationValue: responsive - Matches the width of the container element, height is decided dynamically based on width.
checkout - The PayPal Checkout button. The default button.
credit - The PayPal Credit button. Initializes the credit flow. Cannot be used with any custom color option.
pay - The Pay With PayPal button. Initializes the checkout flow.
buynow - The Buy Now button. Initializes the checkout flow. The default Buy Now button is unbranded.
paypal - The generic PayPal button. Initializes the checkout flow. This button contains only the PayPal brand logo.

property.caption: Tagline
property.description: To disable the tagline/text beneath the button, set to false.

property.caption: Data source
property.description: The line items for this transaction. It can include up to 249 line items.

property.caption: Quantity
property.description: Number of units of the item purchased. This value must be a whole number and can't be negative or zero. DEFAULTS TO '1'.

property.caption: Unit amount*
property.description: Per-unit price of the item. Can include up to 2 decimal places. This value can't be negative or zero.

property.caption: Name*
property.description: Item name. Maximum 127 characters.

property.caption: Kind
property.description: Indicates whether the line item is a debit (sale) or credit (refund) to the customer. Accepted values: debit and credit. DEFAULTS TO 'debit'.

property.caption: Unit tax amount
property.description: Per-unit tax price of the item. Can include up to 2 decimal places. This value can't be negative or zero.

property.caption: Description
property.description: Item description. Maximum 127 characters.

property.caption: Product code
property.description: Product or UPC code for the item. Maximum 127 characters.

property.caption: URL
property.description: The URL to product information.

property.caption: Vault PayPal
property.description: Whether or not to vault the PayPal account upon tokenization. (Only applies when using a client token with a customer id)

property.caption: Apple Pay
property.description: Set to to enable Apple Pay configuration.

property.caption: Button style
property.description: Configures the Apple Pay button style.

property.caption: Display name
property.description: The canonical name for your store. Use a non-localized name. This parameter should be a utf-8 string that is a maximum of 128 characters. The system may display this name to the user.

property.caption: Apple Pay session version
property.description: The version of the ApplePaySession to use. It's recommended to use the lowest version that contains all the features you need for your checkout to maximize compatibility.

property.caption: Merchant capabilities
property.description: "supports3DS" - (Required) This value is always pre-supplied for you. "supportsEMV" - Include this value only if you support China Union Pay transactions. "supportsCredit" - (Optional) If present, only transactions that are categorized as credit cards are allowed. "supportsDebit" - (Optional) If present, only transactions that are categorized as debit cards are allowed.

property.caption: Data source
property.description: Use lineItems to explain additional charges, discounts, and pending costs. Provide the total separately, in the total property.

enumerationValues.enumerationValue: final - A line item representing the known, final cost.
pending - A line item representing an estimated or unknown cost.

property.caption: Label
property.description: Provide a business name for the label field. Use the same business name people will see when they look for the charge on their bank or credit card statement. Must be non-empty to pass validation.

property.caption: Total amount
property.description: The amount of the total must be greater than or equal to zero. Must be non-empty to pass validation.

property.caption: Google Pay
property.description: Set to to enable Google Pay configuration.

property.caption: Merchant ID
property.description: The ID provided by Google for processing transactions in production. Not necessary for testing in sandbox.

property.caption: Google Pay version
property.description: The version of the Google Pay API to use. Defaults to 1, but 2 can be passed in.

property.caption: Currency code
property.description: The ISO 4217 alphabetic currency code.

property.caption: Country code
property.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code where the transaction is processed.

enumerationValues.enumerationValue: NOT_CURRENTLY_KNOWN - Use this property for a capability check.
ESTIMATED - Total price might adjust based on the details of the response, such as sales tax collected that's based on a billing address.
FINAL - Total price doesn't change from the amount presented to the shopper.

property.caption: Total price label
property.description: Custom label for the total price within the display items.

enumerationValues.enumerationValue: DEFAULT - Standard text applies for the given Total price status
COMPLETE_IMMEDIATE_PURCHASE - The selected payment method is charged immediately after the payer confirms their selections. This option is only available when totalPriceStatus is set to FINAL.
default - A Google-selected default value. Currently black but it may change over time
black - A black button suitable for use on white or light backgrounds.
white - A white button suitable for use on colorful backgrounds.
book - The "Book with Google Pay" payment button.
buy - The "Buy with Google Pay" payment button.
checkout - The "Checkout with Google Pay" payment button.
donate - The "Donate with Google Pay" payment button.
order - The "Order with Google Pay" payment button.
pay - The "Pay with Google Pay" payment button.
plain - The Google Pay payment button without the additional text.
subscribe - The "Subscribe with Google Pay" payment button.
static - Button has a static width and height.
fill - Button size changes to fill the size of its container.

property.caption: Data source
property.description: All of the available charges for the current payment request.

property.caption: Label*
property.description: The label to be displayed for the given option.

property.caption: Type
property.description: Type of displayed line item: LINE_ITEM, SUBTOTAL. DEFAULTS TO 'LINE_ITEM'.

property.caption: Price*
property.description: The monetary value of the cart item with an optional decimal precision of two decimal places. Negative values are allowed.

property.caption: Status
property.description: The following variables define price variance: FINAL, PENDING. DEFAULTS TO 'FINAL'.

property.caption: 3D Secure
property.description: When true is passed, the 3D Secure module will be created with a default configuration. See below options for additional create options. If 3D Secure is configured and fails to load, Drop-in creation will fail.

property.caption: Amount
property.description: The amount of the transaction. Required when 3D Secure is enabled.

property.caption: Challenge requested
property.description: If set to true, an authentication challenge will be forced if possible.

property.caption: Exemption requested
property.description: If set to true, an exemption to the authentication challenge will be requested.

property.caption: Email
property.description: The email used for verification. (maximum length 255)

property.caption: Mobile phone number
property.description: The mobile phone number used for verification. Only numbers; remove dashes, parenthesis and other characters. (maximum length 25)

property.caption: Given name
property.description: The first name associated with the billing address. (maximum length 50)

property.caption: Surname
property.description: The last name associated with the billing address. (maximum length 50)

property.caption: Phone number
property.description: The phone number associated with the billing address. Only numbers; remove dashes, parenthesis and other characters.

property.caption: Street address
property.description: Line 1 of the billing address (eg. number, street, etc). (maximum length 50)

property.caption: Extended address
property.description: Line 2 of the billing address (eg. suite, apt #, etc.). (maximum length 50)

property.caption: Line 3
property.description: Line 3 of the billing address if needed (eg. suite, apt #, etc). (maximum length 50)

property.caption: Locality
property.description: The locality (city) name associated with the billing address.

property.caption: Region
property.description: The 2 letter code for US states or an ISO-3166-2 country subdivision code of up to three letters.

property.caption: Postal code
property.description: The zip code or equivalent for countries that have them.

property.caption: Country code alpha 2
property.description: The 2 character country code.

property.caption: On form submit action
property.description: Action to trigger when submit button is clicked and form is successfully processed

property.caption: On form create
property.description: Action to trigger when form is created

property.caption: On form destroy start
property.description: Action to trigger when form starts destruction

property.caption: On form destroy end
property.description: Action to trigger when form ends destruction

property.caption: On form error
property.description: Action to trigger when form errors
